values: Ammo NCOIC will ensure that only authorized ammunition is distributed from unit Ammo Point.
Unit leaders, OIC/ RSO, OC/s and Safeties will be briefed on all authorized ammunition.
Leaders must ensure individuals who handle ammunition, explosives, and pyrotechnics are trained on proper handling procedures and safety.
Soldiers must handle all ammunition with care.
Soldiers must wear eye protection and gloves while handing
pyrotechnics, ammunition and crating/packaging material.
Leaders must enforce no smoking except in designated areas.
Have ten (10) pound fire extinguisher(s) on hand.
Separate incompatible lots/types of ammunition and explosives.
Do not transport ammunition and personnel on same
vehicle.
PCCs /PCIs Safety Briefing O/C & Safety Brief
Ammunition NCO /OIC, Unit leadership Safeties OIC

subtasks.hazard: Negligent Discharge or Weapon Malfunction Causing Bodily Harm

values: All Soldiers will wear all
required PPE while on the range. To include front,back, and side plates
Lane safeties and the OIC / RSO will ensure weapon systems are properly oriented downrange and operating in a safe manner at all times.
Weapon systems will not
be loaded prior to arrival
at firing line.
Weapons will be visual cleared by RSO following completion of the lane.
Weapons will be pointed downrange at all times away from personnel when loaded.
Ensure a Medic and a dedicated
evacuation vehicle
is available at all times.
PMI Conduct safety brief prior to each phase and re-empahasize during tranisition between weapon systems
RSO/ OIC Range Safeties
Range orientation brief during daily range safety brief by RSO.
Range fans clearly marked and visible.
Weapon systems properly cleared before leaving the firing line.
Range orientation brief from the OIC/RSO prior to training.
Range orientation brief from the OIC/RSO prior to training.
Communications with
the gate guards
will be maintained at all
times.
Gate Guards will have
shifts that are not
excessive in length and
be provided supplies to
support their mission
(water, batteries,
frequencies, etc.).
Brief all participants to immediately report potential unauthorized access on the Range or in the live fire area to the OIC and RSO.
Range Safety Brief Task to Troops OIC/RSO Supervision
OIC/RSO Gate Guard personnel

subtasks.hazard: Combustions / Fire at the ammo point

values: Ammo point will have at
least two fire extinguishers on hand.
No smoking withing 50m of ammo point
Ammo will be stored in accordance with Range OPS and 2CR policy.
Ammo point inspected by RSO and OIC
RSO/OIC NCOIC Ammo Point
Medics and CLS qualified personnel on site with CLS bag and MEDEVAC vehicle.
Proper placement of MEDEVAC vehicle during range operations.
Know the location of the AXP.
Soldiers will use 3 points of contact while operating on top of Strykers.
When moving in a wheeled vehicle, Soldiers will wear seat belts and gunner restraints at all times.
All Soldiers on the range will wear proper PPE to include gloves, eye pro, ear pro, and body armor.
RSO inspects MEDEVAC vehicle prior to range operations. RSO briefs MEDEVAC vehicle staging safety brief. On site Medics briefed CASEVAC procedures and route.
RSO/OIC Medics Individual Soldier
OIC will monitor temperature and humidity of ground surface.
Verify fire danger posted by Range Operation daily.
Identify fire team and have appropriate FFE on-hand and ready.
OIC will place range in "DRY" status and notify Range Operation.
Safety brief Fire fighting detail
OIC/RSO Fire fighting detail
Range OIC will adjust
daily risk assessment as
conditions change.
Water point will be
briefed prior to execution
and made available to all
Soldiers to use
Leaders and medics will
enforce hydration and
constantly monitor for
symptoms of heat
exhaustion.
Dry and appropriate cold
weather clothing utilized
if weather permits.
Cold weather clothing included on the Range packing list.
Heating Area available to soldiers executing the range if necessary
Safety Brief Packing List
RSO/OIC Safeties Medics Individual Soldier

subtask.name: Movement to, from, and on Training Site

values: All drivers will conduct vehicle PCIs and PMCS prior to movement. All SMs will adhere to posted speed limit signs, drive defensively, wear restraint harnesses, helmets, and seat-belts.
The vehicle will have a license driver and vehicle commander.
The driver will have a minimum of six hours of rest prior to departure.
All personnel inside the vehicle will wear appropriate unit issued PPE including ACH.
Conduct safety brief at each phase addressing speed, route, and vehicle safety
OIC/RSO Vehicle Commander Crew Driver

subtask.name: Movement to, from, and on Training Site

values: All dispatches if black road conditions are declared will be signed by the Squadron XO
Operators will ensure snow chains are on each vehicle prior to SP from the motorpool
PCCs/PCIs
Vehicle Commander Crew Driver

overall_supervision_plan: This is a living document. Newly identified risks will be recorded and mitigated accordingly and risk acceptance will be approved at the appropriate level.The OIC, RSO, and range leadership will conduct a range safety brief prior to all live fire training. The OIC and RSO are overall responsible for safety. However, team leaders, squad leaders, and safeties have the responsibility to be actively engaged in range activities and Soldier actions so as to mitigate risk at the lowest level possible and ensure overall safety for the training event. Range OIC all first line supervisors are responsible for all actions on the range. Vehicle movement will be restricted on the range once Soldiers are dismounted. All vehicles will be ground guided and parked in designated area. Troops are briefed on the route, travel speed, trail distance, fire drills, roll over drills, communication plan and vehicle safety prior to SP. Medic and CASEVAC Vehicle (Arranged by Range OIC) are on sight. All entry points to range are guarded at all times and guards have communications with OIC or NCOIC.
